content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-049-24-B |Item_parent=Normal and pathological puberty |Item_parent_short=Normal and pathological puberty |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the indication for imaging examinations in abnormal puberty |Description=None |Rubric=Additional examinations |Contributors= |Order=24}} - Pathological peripheral puberty: pelvic ultrasound in girls - Central precocious puberty: brain MRI to look for a tumour affecting the hypothalamo-hypophyseal region

question.question: What is the recommended imaging examination for a girl with abnormal peripheral puberty?
question.option_a: Pelvic ultrasound to evaluate ovarian function
question.option_b: Brain MRI to look for a tumour affecting the hypothalamo-hypophyseal region
question.option_c: Pelvic ultrasound to look for signs of androgen excess
question.option_d: Bone age assessment to evaluate skeletal maturity
